Two questions:
 1) What if you are wrong? 
 2) Given that we are just intelligent animals, what is the purpose of our/your existance?

 
 1) This is Pascal's Wager, and isn't a good question for a couple main reasons. 
 
 First of all, you are assuming only 2 options, believing in a God and going to heaven or not believing and going to hell... but there are thousands of other options, so I can just as easily ask you, What if YOU are wrong? What if Islam or Judaism or Hinduism or Norse paganism or Greek mythology or some random tribal religion is the TRUE religion? I'm assuming you are Christian, so what if you didn't choose the right denomination and it turns out that God really only cares a lot about the Mormons or LDS? 
 
 The second problem is this; The reason I am an atheist is because I the evidence (if it can be called that) is severely lacking and isn't enough to convince me (in fact the evidence is what DEconverted me). Pascal's wager asserts that even if I have my doubts, I should worship a God anyway since there would be no consequences if I am wrong. The problem is that an omnipotent God would surely be able to see through that wager and be able to tell if I am sincere or not. 
 
 2) The meaning of life is whatever you make of it. Whether it's to have a family and provide for them, raise kids, get rich, do whatever makes you happy, be successful in your line of work, help others, make a difference in the world, push the limits of human knowledge, or whatever. 
 
 If you feel like your life would have no meaning if you didn't have your religion, then I feel very sorry for you, because you aren't living life to the fullest.
